channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: China-backed hackers stepping up attacks on Taiwan, cybersecurity firm says
item.description: Hacking group RedJuliett compromised two dozen organisations in Taiwan and elsewhere, report says.

item.title: South Africa hold nerve to beat West Indies, enter T20 World Cup semifinals
item.description: South Africa beat West Indies by three wickets in a rain-interrupted Super Eights game to book a spot in the semis.

item.title: Sikh assassinations: Are the US and Canada raising the heat on India?
item.description: A year after Sikh separatist Hardeep Singh Nijjar's murder, court cases in Canada and US are testing ties with India.

item.title: Australia’s grocer chains face billion-dollar fines over supplier treatment
item.description: Violators of industry code of conduct to be subject to fines of up to 10 percent of annual turnover.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 850
item.description: As the war enters its 850th day, these are the main developments.

item.title: US prosecutors recommend criminal charges for Boeing, report says
item.description: US Justice Department has until July 7 to prosecute aircraft giant over breaches of settlement related to fatal crashes.

item.title: Xi eyes military supremacy as he reorganises China’s armed forces
item.description: China's president stresses need for ongoing reform as he tightens his control over the People's Liberation Army.

item.title: Netanyahu says war will continue even if ceasefire deal agreed with Hamas
item.description: The Israeli prime minister reiterated he would not agree to any deal that calls for an end to the eight-month war.

item.title: Bahrain and Iran agree to start talks aimed at restoring ties
item.description: Bahrain had cut ties with Iran in 2016, but relations improved following the Saudi-Iranian rapprochement last year.

item.title: Seven dead, dozens missing after attack in northern Nigeria
item.description: Residents say gunmen on motorbikes arrived in Maidabino village in Katsina state and started shooting sporadically.

item.title: Germany’s Scholz expresses concern over a far-right victory in France
item.description: France heads to the polls in July for a snap election and opinion polls predict President Macron's party will lose.

item.title: Texas woman charged after ‘attempting to drown’ Palestinian child
item.description: Woman charged with attempted murder as CAIR urges authorities to investigate US incident as a 'hate crime'.

item.title: More than a dozen killed in synagogue, church attacks in Russia’s Dagestan
item.description: Civilians and a priest among dead as gunmen attack religious buildings in Derbent and a Makhachkala police post.

item.title: What if Israel’s plan was no ‘day after’ for Gaza all along?
item.description: Political scientist Nathan Brown says Israel is fighting a different war in Gaza than US officials care to admit.

item.title: Formula One: Verstappen wins Spanish Grand Prix, extends championship lead
item.description: Red Bull's three-time world motorsports champ makes it seven wins from 10 races by defeating Lando Norris in Barcelona.

item.title: Albania says player banned for two Euro 2024 games for ‘nationalist’ chants
item.description: The ban comes after player Mirlind Daku apologised for leading fans in derogatory chants against Croatia at Euro 2024.

item.title: Kenya’s Ruto agrees ‘for conversation’ with protesters over tax hikes
item.description: The weeklong protests have caught Ruto's government off-guard, as discontent mounts over his economic policies.

item.title: Week in pictures: From Putin visiting North Korea to International Yoga Day
item.description: A roundup of some of last week's events.

item.title: Traumatised Palestinian detainee describes torture in Israeli custody
item.description: Visibly traumatised Palestinian man Badr Dahlan, has described being tortured by Israeli forces who seized him.

item.title: Which teams can qualify for the ICC T20 World Cup 2024 semifinals, and how?
item.description: Can Afghanistan enter the semis? What do West Indies need to do? Will net run rate come into play? Al Jazeera explains.

item.title: UEFA Euro 2024: Will France’s Mbappe be fit to play against Poland?
item.description: Captain Kylian Mbappe is racing against time to return for France's last group football match against Poland on Tuesday.

item.title: Israel kills more than 100 Palestinians in 24 hours
item.description: Rescuers try to save Palestinians buried under the rubble after Israeli attacks across Gaza killed 100 people in a day.

item.title: WFP’s Matthew Hollingworth on Gaza: ‘Famine means failure’
item.description: WFP’s Palestine director on urgent aid in Gaza, where trapped civilians struggle amid a collapsed infrastructure.

item.title: At least eight killed in Israeli air strike on UNRWA aid centre in Gaza
item.description: The main gate of the compound, facilitating aid distribution and housing the displaced, hit in the attack.

item.title: Yemen’s Houthis claim joint raid on Israeli ships with Iraqi militia
item.description: The Houthis say they targeted vessels in Israel’s Haifa port together with the Islamic Resistance in Iraq.
